data.text: @ItaOKelly I love this article Ita 🌈
@Casserly_Rock @ItaOKelly @gazzahead I really want to get a job in social care.. or involved in homelessness or with disadvantaged children.. it's hard to get into though xx

@ItaOKelly I agree Ita that U can never be over educated,though I feel sorry for students,in particular young people in today’s job https://t.co/pD7HMXYdQG are changing,indeed in some cases are actually disappearing. It’s hard to survive without an education from the #UniversityOfHardKnocks
@MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Spot on Michael.

@ItaOKelly @MichaelMDowling @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Not a dig at you Ita but if it were not for widespread corruption amongst government officials the "cost to the taxpayer" would matter little. Nobody should be dissuaded from attending 3rd level education. Those at bottom of the food chain paying the piper for another's tune.

@gazzahead @MichaelMDowling @fingalpimpernel @pmbairrins @BarbaraMcMahon8 Yes and in teaching/lecturing and the rest.
Employment stats include people who are part-time and casual workers. Technically employed but barely so.

@MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @fingalpimpernel @pmbairrins @BarbaraMcMahon8 Well Mick get your ass over to Ireland and try and get a start on a site here .. they will insist you reg as self employed ... you won’t get the rate .. you will get a few hrs today no hrs tomorrow and pumped out the gate with a mins notice .. come join the Party lad ,

@ItaOKelly @MichaelMDowling @pmbairrins @gazzahead My thesis for Human Development was Challenges Facing Mature Students Returning to 3rd Level.. finances, childcare & lack of emotional support were the top 3 issues. It was an eye opener even if the whole process nearly killed me lol 🤗
@MichaelMDowling @fingalpimpernel @pmbairrins @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Many are self-employed and/or seriously underemployed

@MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead I don’t think a degree or post grad provides the same career assurances as twenty years ago. I think trades and apprenticeship programmes need much more investment.

@MichaelMDowling @pmbairrins @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead What about the gig economy aka the Precariat?
Can't plan ahead, can't get a mortgage.
@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead F**l me, it’s saying 100km to go !!!
@FBuckley17 @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Well, the fuel gauge is below the half way mark!
@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead On at 4 so, gonna drop our interesting conversation!!

@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Im telling yah, you do not know for whom the bell tolls.... it tolls for thee !!

I’m telling you Peter, turning 50 just put my mind a different way and I’d like to think I’ve been prudent enough not to have to work til I’m 70 which is the way the govt sees the issue. Timeout LFC
@FBuckley17 @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Well, time is limited at any age because nobody knows when they’re going to die!

@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Sure, you could live til 80 but you won’t be able to do f**k all. He could have hit me with a brick, it was a Saul on road to Damascus moment.

So, I think time is limited from 50 on as not in the same way as at 30 and killing yourself for some employer is not the way I’d do it

@FBuckley17 @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Yes, ain’t that the truth! And, yet, how many people do not want to retire at 65? I think a gradual step down over 5 years should be available if a person chooses.

@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Also, I had a seminal moment in 2016 walking back from a table quiz one night with a mate of mine. He was going to the US, coming home, then going to Spain (hols). I turned on him (p**sed as I was) and said where’s the f**king money for this. He said, we’ve got 20 years left

@FBuckley17 @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead I think in any job each person has to decide on the benefit v earnings ratio they desire. Some people want/need the big bucks and therefore sacrifice free time and endure stress. It’s about finding the right balance to suit personal circumstances/ambitions.

@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Well I’m couldn’t imagine doing the hours I did, deadlines + stress etc, in 10 years time so, I did save heavily enough into my pension. What I have now is a gap between 54-60 and that’s my issue, which is where the interim mgt thingy comes in

@FBuckley17 @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Depends on the situation. 50 will soon be a relatively young point in the length of a working life. I think interim work and contracts are fine if you’ve retired early and have a pension behind you.

@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Like I said though, I’m not that bothered with a permanent job and all the buy-in that it requires. I was very prudent in terms of borrowing (never had f**k all growing up) so, my mortgage is low, one child (now 15) and you say, well why do all the stress for some young shit

@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Really !! I like the idea of interim mgt (maternity covers etc). I start with the thing that I don’t give a shit for your vision, mission etc. I’m here to do a job, I’ve seen too many of you people (not you literally!!) coming in with your fancy powerpoints, and you know f**k all
@FBuckley17 @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead But I have seen people over 50 securing permanent jobs.
@FBuckley17 @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Wouldn’t interest me either.

@pmbairrins @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead I had my moments Peter but, as they say, all careers end in failure. No, my issue is that beyond a certain age, no employer wants you but, I think on a fixed term basis, they are more favorable. Taken me some time to catch on here but, I think that’s the future... and it may suit
@FBuckley17 @TinaMur79949519 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead It’s sounds as if you’d have been stellar at “corporate” level, with the big boys.

@TinaMur79949519 @pmbairrins @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead I think we have to aim on this interim mgt market mate, which at my age I’m actually happy with. I don’t want to get into this corporate bullshit again....you know the score... company mission statement, values etc etc. I just want to do the job and let the luvvies get on with it
@TinaMur79949519 @FBuckley17 @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead In Dublin?

@ItaOKelly @MichaelMDowling @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Forced retirement provides, at least, an income in a pension. 

I'm on social welfare and being viewed as 'scamming' the system if @campaignforleo is to be believed! His government pays €Millions to British companies like Turas Nua and Seetec to hide us from the live register!
@pmbairrins @MichaelMDowling @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Agree
@TinaMur79949519 @pmbairrins @MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead That applies even in your 50s, nobody wants you. Reckons you’re an old-timer
@MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead I’m not sure that’s true!

@MichaelMDowling @ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead I'm not sure anything helps anymore. Once you reach a certain age, regardless of qualifications or skills, nobody wants you.

Ireland wants people to work until we're 70 but employers don't want to invest in older people.
@ItaOKelly @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead I'm constantly amazed that people, for example, have a PhD in physics, yet end up as an insurance salesman, by choice.

@MichaelMDowling @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead Well that is the American system. But it is a big money industry there and not funded by taxpayer on the whole. It would add more years to the study programme.
Many parents have a finite amount of money to fund adult students...

@MichaelMDowling @BarbaraMcMahon8 @gazzahead I agree with that and would add critical thinking.
However not everybody needs to attend third level and many do not adjust and drop out, at great cost to the taxpayer.
@AidanMcCourt I will bear that in mind...
@LeighLeighjm56 Thank you!

@ItaOKelly I agree largely with the main theme of your piece, but in your old age, as you become less able to do the everyday things in life, you may be grateful for one or two of these ‘giant children’ around the place to help you.
@FionnualaGreene Thanks Fionnuala.

@ItaOKelly @gazzahead I began my degree in humanities in 2006, dropped out in 2008. Went back in 2015.. I had done English and history originally but because I was now a carer I changed to eng and human development because I felt it was more beneficial to me.. xx
@ItaOKelly @gazzahead I worked in retail for years. 11 years ago I became a carer. If you'd asked me 28 years ago if I'd be a carer I'd have said noway.. 🤗
@ItaOKelly She can't get experience unless she's given a chance.. a vicious circle..

@ItaOKelly @gazzahead Great article Ita.. my 18 yr old sits her LC in June. Has she a clue of what she wants to do? Nope.. yet she had to select a min of 10 courses on the CAO. I suggested she chose a variety.. she wants a job to have her own money but nobody will hire her as she's not experienced?
